name: Looking for tips to pick a build for swordflight replay
author: delerion

posts.author: delerion
posts.content:
Greetings!

I hope this is the right forum to post in, i am currently playing through swordflight with a evil arcane archer using the black arrow build, (thanks to EasternPromises)

I am already planning to replay it this time as a good-aligned melee character, and as something non-elf, so as to see the campaign from a different perspective.

Here is what i was thinking:
A Dwarf Paladin, something that has some staying power in melee, maybe doable with a 'damage adept' style build using expertise and divine shield while dealing out damage with a scythe?

I checked out some builds already but most of them are made with human race, i assume due to the high feat requirements of weapon-master, is this doable with a dwarf instead of human?

Another thing i worry about is my character having more levels in WM instead of paladin, locking me out of some class-specific content, to my understanding your highest level class is the one swordflight modules treats you as(though, if paladin and WM get access to the same 'fighter' style content then it doesn't matter)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello and welcome, delerion!

This is indeed the right place for your query. Your basic problem with a Dwarf Paladin is the CHA penalty our bearded friends suffer from, so you run the risk of spreading your stats miserably thin if you want to make good use of Pally-specific attributes. Have you considered maybe a Dwarven Defender/ Fighter/ WM or a Fighter/ CoT/ WM? The first would be horribly feat starved - though not impossible, but the second should be worth a look I'd think.

Cheers

posts.author: delerion
posts.content:
Thanks for your reply!

Yeah looks like i had a bit too many restrictions, i will have to decide between going human paladin or a dwarf melee character, perhaps i will miss on a paladin-specific quest but still playing as a good-aligned melee with no umd will be a big change of pace from my previous character.

To deal with crit immune enemies as a scythe-user i feel like having a character with divine might is very helpful, i will look into some human builds also.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
If you're sure you want to go with a scythe and don't mind going with human, how about this one? It's one of Valerfor's, and is a Fighter 10/ Paladin 5/ WM 25. Have a look...

Harvester of Souls

Cheers

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Greetings delerion!
It sounds like you are still deciding on what you would like to play.
RE Paladins are a multiple-attribute dependent (MAD) class, every attribute seems to be useful.
Human is very helpful with the extra feat and extra 43 skill points, it allows investment in a skill such as Taunt for example.
I also find Paladin and RDD a nice combination due to the multiple attribute boosts from RDD, I do not know Swordflight very well, however the readme on the vault seems to indicate Chapter Four gets to lvl 33.
Weaponmaster and paladin is a tough combination unless you take fighter or perhaps CoT due to all the feat requirements of weapon master

You did mention divine damage, I did attempt a divine hammer draft using RDD which might be of interest, perhaps you could modify it to your requirements, I would probably take the Sorc/RDD stuff as soon as you hit Lvl 21 so you can experience the complete boost in stats by lvl 31, then get undispellability if there is a Swordflight Chapter Five.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I have not (yet) played Swordflight, but it has been my experience that NPCs will identify you as being whatever class you take at level 1.  So, a Bard 8 / Fighter 22 / RDD 10 with Bard at level 1 will be a Bard as far as the NPCs are concerned, even though that is the class with the fewest levels.
